description: First attested with this spelling in 1623 C.E., from earlier subpena, from Middle English sub pena, from  Medieval Latin: sub (“under”) and poena (“penalty”), the beginning of the original subpoena used in the Court of Chancery.

nouns.description: subpoena (plural subpoenas or subpoenae or subpoenæ)

entries.meaning: (law, historical) A writ requiring a defendant to appear in court to answer a plaintiff's claim.
(law) A writ requiring someone to appear in court to give testimony.

verbs.description: subpoena (third-person singular simple present subpoenas, present participle subpoenaing, simple past and past participle subpoenaed)
